data.title: Weak Rumour - Arthur Cabral (Fwd, Benfica, 26)

#4

Decent profile of development since he made the move from Brazil in 2019.

32 in 53 games at Basel

Top scorer in all competitions in his only season (22/23) at Fiorentina, (joint) Conference Lg top scorer in their march to the final against Wham.

Sold to Benfica for ¬£17m + ¬£4.25m in add-ons last summer.....with a buy out clause set at ¬£84.9m(!).

Tall at 6'1'' so basically a Thiago footballing sibling.

#8

Does look a bit like a cut price Thiago - this was the assessment of him from a Basel journalist talking to a Fiorentina website;

He can hold up the ball when playing with his back to the goal. But he is also able to run onto the defender with the ball on his feet. He feels most comfortable within the opponent‚Äôs 18 yard box, though. This is where he shines as he has a nose for the right movement. He also tries to get a part of his body onto every ball played into the box. He has the will to score goals and he shows it often. But that‚Äôs not everything. Don‚Äôt let him shoot from outside the box. He scored a wonder goal against FC Zurich this season, where he smashed the ball into the net from 35 yards out. Technically he‚Äôs good, with the occasional miscontrol when running with the ball, and he has decent speed. He excels with his physicality though. He is able to push off defenders and create a yard of space for himself.

Oliver Zesiger gives the lowdown on Arthur Cabral

Zesiger, a football scout and Basel fan, can help you learn a bit more about the Brazilian
